name: Hilton Sharm El Sheikh Fayrouz Resort

reviews.text: I was staying in the hotel on business and so didn't get much chance to take advantage of the facilities, but what I did see I was very impressed with.
reviews.title: I can see why it's #1

likes.disliked: — Bath could be a litle nicer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As is quite usual in Egypt, the staff were very friendly. However, what is quite unusual for Egypt is that they also seemed very competent.
reviews.title: A really great holiday

reviews.text: The room was very nice - looked as if it has been refurbished a year or two ago. A few knocks here and there, but I thought that it was very good value for money.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton Fayrouz

likes.disliked: — Bathrooms could do with an update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Living in Hurghada, I know that Hilton license their brand to some very poor hotels, but this one is definitely up to Hilton standards.
reviews.title: Dated Accommodation, but great beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was excellent - within easy walking distance of all of the attractions of Naama Bay.
reviews.title: Not just another review

likes.disliked: — the bathroom was a little small

reviews.text: I have just come back from a weeks stay at this hotel and wholeheartedly agree with the reviews from here.
reviews.title: A quality all round hotel experience

reviews.text: The stay was perfect from start to finish.
reviews.title: Good, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travelled on my own because my girlfriend had to drop out but was made to feel so welcome by the staff and made many friends while there.
reviews.title: Best Beach in Sharm

likes.liked: — The fantastic beach, sea and snorkelling
likes.disliked: — Having to leave and return to cold old England

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the rooms mean that you are at worst a 2 minute walk from the private beach and i never had a problem getting a chair and a decent location whatever the time of day.
reviews.title: Friendly people, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were exceptional and any problems i had were dealt with promptly (only problem i did have) food i ordered on room service didn't turn up. One phone call and i promptly got it and they waved the charge of the food and service.
reviews.title: Superb Location & Beach

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms, excellent service, loads of choice of bars, food & very chilled out

reviews.text: Most of this review is a repeat of the other reviews.Stayed 1st -15th May
reviews.title: Recomend this hotel to everyone.

reviews.text: We asked for and were given an upper room overlooking the pool at rear of property,Large clean(spotless) rooms with very large balony. The garden rooms also looked great,one of the nicest gardens we`ve ever seen in a hotel.
reviews.title: 5 star staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were great, very friendly, and always seemed happy even when not dealing with customers.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

likes.disliked: — Early morning trip to reserve (shaded) sunbeds on beach

reviews.title: Great Holiday at Fayrouz
reviews.text: The beach area was busy, however I`m always awake at 7 o clock, so never had a problem with the sunbeds.
The snorkelling was great off the reef in front of the Hilton, it was even better off the reef at the Sofitel, however the Glass bottom boats started to come in about 9 O clock.
reviews.title: Beautiful and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived our room at the Fayrouz it was dark and the initial signs were not good, the little bungalows are getting quite tired now and in particular the bathrooms are overdue a refurb and the aircon was the old noisy type, 5* I thought? You are kidding! Not withstanding this, the room was clean and had all the amenities one might need. In the morning however you can start to appreciate the wonderful location that this hotel affords, we had paid extra for a beachside room and I would recommend this as if you are over the other side the constant beeping of the Egyptians car horns might become annoying.The lush gardens are beutifully tended and the beach is well guarded and immaculate. But what sets this hotel apart is the ever attentive service of the hotel staff, nothing is ever too much trouble and everyone from the manager to the gardener smiles and says hello in perfect English everytime they see you. The food was of exceptional quality every night and they offered a good variety with a different 'theme' every night. Some warned of 'not eating the salad or rice or having ice in your drinks' but I can honestly say this was not an issue in the hotel, the only obvious point is not to drink the tap water. if you do need bottled water however nip round the corner to the little supermarket where it is 25p a bottle rather than the £1.60 the hotle choses to charge! The weather was in the mid 30's every day and we did not see a single cloud for the whole week, if you need a relaxing break with guarenteed sunshine I can heartly recommend the Fayrouz - we will be back.
reviews.title: Super hotel but in need of a little tlc.

reviews.text: I was really impressed with this hotel and literally did not want to come home.
reviews.title: Wish I was still there !!

likes.liked: — The beds, pillows and friendliness of staff

reviews.text: Firstly the location is spot on, it is a short walk from naama bay centre with its own lovely private beach and excursion centre (sun and fun - the guys are brilliant and very trustworthy) we did not have a problem with noise at all during our stay.
reviews.title: Really Very Good!

likes.disliked: — the bathroom could do with a refit!

reviews.text: The rooms are good to very clean and comfortable. The bathrooms could do with updating and are a bit on the small side but this did not cause us a problem. The mini bar is well stocked and very cheap.
reviews.title: Worth a visit

likes.liked: — Pool bar and beds are very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gardens are gorgeous, you can tell they are very well looked after and all the rooms look out onto gardens, pool or beach.
reviews.title: Very good hotel overall

likes.disliked: — Slightly dated rooms, poor fitness centre

aka: Hilton Sharm El Sheikh Fayrouz Hotel Sharm El Sheikh
description: Commanding a central position in Naama Bay, the hotel is enclosed within beautiful landscaped gardens and has the advantage of the longest stretch of sandy beach in he bay. Just a short walk along the promenade will take you to the bustling centre of the bay home to a variety of shops and local nightlife.
